title: Non-measurable set
summary: In mathematics, a non-measurable set is a set which cannot be assigned a meaningful "volume".  The mathematical existence of such sets is construed to provide information about the notions of length, area and volume in formal set theory. In Zermeloâ€“Fraenkel set theory, the axiom of choice entails that non-measurable subsets of R {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} } exist.
